result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. Riley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J. Riley

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, William J. Riley, appeared with Attorney Frederick L. Zievers.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  PSI waived by parties and sentencing arguments made.  Court imposes a fine of $300 plus costs & surcharges and is due in 30 days or Civil Judgment.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Per ADA Graveley case is resolved and will be a plea on Monday.
Jury trial on August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Def. is having medical issues.  At request of Atty Zievers and with approval of ADA Graveley, JSH on 6/18/15 and JT on 6/22/15 are removed from the calendar.  JT reset for 8/10/15 at 8:30.  No JSH set; counsel to notify Br. 8 clerk by 8/6/15 as to status of case.
Demand for Discovery filed by  DDP M Graveley

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, William J. Riley, appeared with Attorney Frederick L. Zievers.   Clerk: PT
Case is not resolved at this time.  Jury Status on 6/18/15 at 1:00 PM; Jury Trial on 6/22/15 at 8:30 AM.
Final pre-trial on March 6, 2015 at 09:10 am confirmed with Atty Zievers & Atty Graveley
Due to a continued jury trial; FPT rescheduled to 3/6/15 at 9:10 AM pending confirmation from Atty Graveley and Atty Zievers.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, William J. Riley, appeared with Attorney Frederick L. Zievers.  Clerk: PT
Parties recently received documentation regarding some medical issues and mutually agree to an adjournment.  Court grants adjournment.  FPT on 2/12/15 at 10:20 AM.
Final pre-trial on December 19, 2014 at 09:10 am.
Due to a continued jury trial; FPT rescheduled to 12/19/14 at 9:10 AM per confirmation with Atty Ziever's Office & Atty Graveley's Office

Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Zievers. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 11-6-14 @ 9:10am. Bond continued.
